commits.commitMessage:
Move to use ntpdate from ntpd for print-only clock time

This patch integrates with LXSWIREF-1498 to use the newly added ntpdate
command to provide print-only clock time without updating it into the
device's system clock.

Resolves: LE-14823
Relates: LXSWIREF-1498
Change-Id: Ia0ea055296e9cd098181b75ebf6e2bb989d131c8
commits.subject: Move to use ntpdate from ntpd for print-only clock time

commits.commitMessage:
Implement new Legato Clock Service usable via APIs and LWM2M object 33405

This set of patches implements the new Clock Service in Legato, its le_clkSync
APIs, LWM2M object 33405 & AVC code to use these APIs to give AV a means to
update a device's clock time, the Linux interface to update an NTP acquired
time into the system clock, and moves clock related code in DCS into this new
service.

Resolves: LE-12702 LE-11503
Related: LE-13214 LE-12714 LE-13137
Change-Id: I44e98f6c631358c346e0f07735449c26b91e7420
commits.subject: Implement new Legato Clock Service usable via APIs and LWM2M object 33405

comments.message:
Klocwork [Critical RNPD.CALL #557]

> Suspicious dereference of pointer 'timePtr' by passing argument 1 to function 'memset' at line 118 before NULL check at line 119

Klocwork [Critical RNPD.CALL #4691 @ wp76xx]

> Suspicious dereference of pointer 'timePtr' by passing argument 1 to function 'memset' at line 118 before NULL check at line 119

Please use inet_ntop to write the string:

    inet_ntop(serverPtr->sin_family, serverPtr->sin_addr, ipAddrPtr, LE_DCS_IPADDR_MAX_LEN);
Generally I prefer LE_ASSERT() if something is not supposed to happen.
But the difference is in having the calling process killed, which is most of the time too drastic for PA code. As this function is a Get() operation, such killing would be too extreme.
But passing NULL to functions like this indicates a programmer error, and personally I feel it is better to fail fast and fail hard in those cases.  I won't make an issue of it though.

Thanks for your feedback. This PA code is also used by existing/old external le_data APIs. For other similar cases, we don't kill the client app. Thus, it's better to be consistent here. For the new code & APIs, yes, I agree with you.
